stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.

stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.

preGame:
LADIES, GENTLEMEN, AND CREATURES OF THE NIGHT! Welcome back to another bone-crushing Tuesday Night Trollball! I am your host, Nok the Corrupter, broadcasting LIVE from the crumbling, sulfur-choked ruins of The Su'akour Bowl! Take a deep breath of that rotten egg air, folks—it smells like VIOLENCE! We have a spectacular matchup tonight as the mountain-dwelling Confluence Captains descend from the clouds to face the swamp-hardened Brimstone Fire Eaters! 

And hold onto your livers, sports fans, because tonight is an OPEN BAR MATCH! That's right! The ale is flowing, the spirits are high, and the coordination is about to hit rock bottom! I expect sloppy tackles, missed passes, and absolutely zero inhibitions on the field tonight! 

Looking at the home team, the Brimstone Fire Eaters are representing the faction of Eponore. You know, where Sir Tanos—my boss Lord Orzalon's 'best friend'—and that shiny, preening Moonslayer Artorias hang out. But these players look a lot tougher than those knights in shining armor! I watched Bollinger Susette in the warm-ups, and their ritual involves getting punched in the shoulder as hard as possible! Now THAT is how you wake up! And look at Campball Fink, stomping around in the muddiest puddles they can find. Delightfully primal!

Visiting us from the Guild of the Black Sky's territory are the Confluence Captains! These folks are used to the high life, but they aren't afraid to get dirty. I saw Ladew Evelina chugging a raw egg, shell and all—crunchy! And Richia Pazit was over there gently headbutting the goal post. I hope the post is okay! They've got the backing of the Guild, so you know they're here to collect a paycheck in pain!

 It’s going to be a messy, drunken brawl in the ruins! Will the Captains navigate the uneven ground, or will the Fire Eaters use the noxious fumes to their advantage? Grab a drink, folks, because the players certainly have! LET'S PLAY TROLLBALL!
postGame:
By the dark gods, what a display of drunken debauchery and beautiful brutality! If you love watching people stumble, vomit, and shatter bones, tonight was a five-star meal! The Confluence Captains stumbled their way to victory, defeating the Brimstone Fire Eaters with a final score of 2 to 1! The alcohol was the real MVP tonight, claiming more coordination than any defender ever could!

The game started with a bang—and a crunch! Vonni Geoff of the Captains wasted no time, flattening Bollinger Susette with a tackle that surely rattled some teeth. INJURY right out of the gate! But the Fire Eaters didn't take that lying down! Wylde Jutta—an absolute beast on the field—retaliated by smashing Vonni Geoff into the dirt, sending them off to the healer's tent! An eye for an eye, a rib for a rib!

Amidst the early violence, the Captains found a moment of clarity! Richia Pazit managed to weave through the chaos and connected with Stephan Lisk in the End Zone. Lisk dunked that leather head with authority! GOAL CAPTAINS! 1-0! The Guild's investment is paying off early!

But then, the open bar started to take its toll! 'Immense amounts of alcohol are consumed,' the report says, and boy, did it show! Players were swaying, eyes were glazing over! But Wylde Jutta? They must have a liver made of iron! While everyone else was looking tipsy, Jutta stormed into the End Zone and slammed home the equalizer! GOAL FIRE EATERS! We were tied at 1-1 going into halftime!

Halftime was less of a strategy meeting and more of a nap time, but they dragged themselves back out for the second half. And folks, this is where it turned into a slaughterhouse! The healers were working overtime! Wylde Jutta continued their rampage, tackling Behl Berstine so hard they had to be carried off! But the Captains are resilient! 

Behl Berstine came back from the dead—thanks to healer Kant Langill—and immediately took out their anger on Orlina Jerrine! CRUNCH! Another injury! Then Nachison Icken decided it was their turn, drunkenly throwing their body weight around to injure Vonni Geoff AGAIN! Geoff just couldn't catch a break tonight! And let's not forget Campball Fink taking out O'Conner Maighdlin! It was a symphony of snaps and groans!

Through the haze of intoxication and pain, a hero emerged for the Captains! Carnahan Laud, stumbling, weaving, perhaps seeing three goalposts, managed to run the ball into the End Zone! GOAL CAPTAINS! They took the lead 2-1, and the away crowd went wild—or maybe they just fell over!

The Fire Eaters tried to mount a comeback, but the drink had them in a chokehold. Belding Chloe was running with the enthusiasm of a berserker but the direction of a confused moth. Ladew Evelina tried to shoot for a 2-pointer and I'm pretty sure they almost hit a spectator in the third row! 

But Ladew made up for that embarrassing miss with one last act of violence, absolutely leveling Nigel Rothmuller! That's the spirit! Even when you're losing coordination, never lose your bloodlust! 

In the end, the Confluence Captains held on to their lead! A big win for the Guild of the Black Sky! Perhaps Chairman Garon Ironrock can use the winnings to buy a door that actually locks! As for the Fire Eaters and their Eponore fans... well, maybe Sir Artorias can write a sad poem about it. The Captains win, the booze wins, and we all win for having witnessed it! I'm Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that it's not whether you win or lose, it's how many people you hurt along the way! GOODNIGHT OSTERRA!
